revised_title: Infrared Day and Night Airglow of Earth: A Review of Emission Features and Altitude Distributions
tldr: This article discusses the day and night airglow emission of the Earth's atmosphere in the infrared region of the spectrum, focusing on the principal emission features and their expected intensities and altitude distributions. It covers various atmospheric constituents, such as water vapor, carbon dioxide, ozone, nitrous oxide, methane, carbon monoxide, nitrogen dioxide, nitric oxide, hydrogen peroxide, nitrogen, and oxygen, and their roles in the airglow spectrum.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
